meanings.definition: Capable of being connected by wires.
meanings.sent1: The new computer is wirable, allowing for easy connection to other devices.
meanings.sent2: The wirable TV was simple to set up with all the necessary cables.
meanings.sent3: The wirable toaster decided to make friends with the microwave.
meanings.sent4: Her wirable personality made her the perfect candidate for networking events.
meanings.sent5: The wirable puzzle pieces clicked together effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Able to have wires installed or connected.
meanings.sent1: The wirable house had outlets in every room for convenient charging.
meanings.sent2: The wirable lamp needed to be plugged in to light up the room.
meanings.sent3: The wirable cat got tangled in the Christmas lights again.
meanings.sent4: His wirable mind was always coming up with new electrical inventions.
meanings.sent5: The wirable fence kept the dog safely contained in the yard.
